At Sonos we want to create the ultimate listening experience for our customers and know that it starts by listening to each other. As part of the Sonos team, you’ll collaborate with people of all styles, skill sets, and backgrounds to realize our vision while fostering a community where everyone feels included and empowered to do the best work of their lives.“This role can be done from homeBuilding the world’s leading sound experience starts with the experience we provide for our people. That’s why we’ve been distributed from the start: initially between offices in Boston & Santa Barbara, and now with additional offices in Seattle, San Francisco & Paris. This role can be done from anywhere in the United States or Canada- any of our offices, or remotely from home. It’s about impact, not location.”We want to deliver data-driven solutions and insights that inform every Customer Experience (CX) decision, and enable us to know our customers better. By anticipating the needs of our customers, we envision providing optimal solutions and services to our customers worldwide. The Sonos CX environment is dynamic, fast-paced, highly collaborative, covering a broad range of strategic and business critical topics. The leader will communicate complex and dynamic information in new and creative ways.Responsibilities:Deliver insightful analyses and recommendations that can be acted upon by the CX organizationFrame, investigate, and answer key business questions through research and analytics plans.Includes primary CX research, key performance tracking, and customer data mining to fully understand, generate insights, and contribute to the CX StrategyLead the identification of information needs, design of CX research and data analytics plans, and the overall management of the CX analytics processConnect advanced data analytics and customer insights together to tell a compelling and persuasive story that delivers clear and actionable CX recommendationsContribute to advancement of Business Analytics and Insights capabilities and seek to share knowledge and expertise with other organizations such as Go To Market and Hardware Operations.Lead alignment with other analytic functions (such as GTM Analytics) to ensure cohesive activities with our stakeholders and facilitate best practice sharing.Partner with other analytic teams to advance the use of other data sources.Demonstrate a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.Basic Qualifications10+ years of experience in customer facing organization(s), with 5+ years leading insights and analytics functionAt least 3 years experience within data, data science, customer support/business analytics and supervising data analysts, BI specialists, and collaborating with data and machine learning engineers.Known subject matter expert for quantitative and qualitative analytics methodologiesAbility to identify, prioritize and describe relevant caveats and uncertainties in research, analytic projects, and forecasts, including how they relate to the business question and broader customer services and support strategic prioritiesRecognized expertise and coach to others on connecting, integrating, and synthesizing analysis into a meaningful ‘so what’ to drive clear strategic recommendations and enable commercial decision makingAbility to be flexible, prioritize multiple demands, deal with ambiguity, and lead teams through complex and challenging cross-functional projectsPrevious demonstrated Business and Customer Centricity acumenPreferred QualificationsCustomer Experience, Support, Success, and/or Services experienceContact Center Data analysis and KPI reporting via tools such as Tableau/SnowflakeWe consider a wide range of factors when determining compensation, which may cause compensation to vary depending on your skills, experience and qualifications. This job is also eligible for discretionary bonuses as well as an opportunity to become a Sonos shareholder because all full time employees are eligible for stock grants. The minimum base pay may be modified in the future based on changing market conditions. The starting minimum base pay for this role is:$189,000We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including open time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and other benefits subject to eligibility requirements.Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.Your profile will be reviewed and you'll hear from us once we have an update. At Sonos we take the time to hire right and appreciate your patience.Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
